TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WmpBitmapEncoder extends System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder

Docs.summary: Defines an encoder that is used to encode [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wdp](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-wdp-md.md)] images.

remarks.format: ## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wdp](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-wdp-md.md)] is a new codec that provides better image fidelity than [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_jpegorg](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-jpegorg-md.md)] with smaller file sizes and more features. [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wdp](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-wdp-md.md)] images achieve lossy and lossless compression by using a single algorithm. [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wdp](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-wdp-md.md)] images support existing metadata standards. For additional information about this format, see [Windows Media Photo Specification](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/wmphoto.mspx). [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_wdp](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-wdp-md.md)] files do not support preview, global thumbnails, frame level thumbnails, or multiple frames. Encoding does not work in partial trust. See [WPF Partial Trust Security](../Topic/WPF%20Partial%20Trust%20Security.md) for information on partial trust. ## XAML Text Usage

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder"> class.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to initialize a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.WmpBitmapEncoder> to encode a new bitmap image.
[!code-cpp[wdpbitmapdecoderencoder#3](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/wdpencoderdecoder/WDPEncoderDecoder.cpp#3)] [!code-cs[wdpbitmapdecoderencoder#3](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/WDPEncoderDecoder/WDPEncoderDecoder.cs#3)] [!code-vb[wdpbitmapdecoderencoder#3](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/WDPEncoderDecoder/WDPEncoderDecoder.vb#3)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the level of alpha frequency data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.
Docs.value:
The level of alpha data to discard when encoding the image. The value range is 0 (no data discarded) to 4 (alpha channel completely discarded). The default is 1.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |0|No image frequency data is discarded.| |1|FlexBits are discarded. The image quality of the image is reduced without changing the effective resolution of the image.| |2|HighPass frequency data band is discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 4 in both dimensions.| |3|HighPass and LowPass frequency data bands are discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 16 in both dimensions.| |4|The alpha channel is completely discarded. The pixel format is changed to reflect the removal of the alpha channel.|

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has an effect only if is set to `true` and the image contains either a planar or interleaved alpha channel; otherwise, it is ignored. ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the compression quality for a planar alpha channel.
Docs.value: The compression quality for a planar alpha channel image. A value of 1 is considered lossless, and increasing values result in higher compression ratios and lower image quality. The value range is 1 to 255. The default is 1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has an effect only if is `false`. ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether compressed domain operations can be used. Compressed domain operations are transformation operations that are done without decoding the image data.
Docs.value: `true` if compressed domain operations can be used; otherwise, `false`. The default is `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to flip the image horizontally.
Docs.value: `true` if the image is to be flipped horizontally; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to flip the image vertically.
Docs.value: `true` if the image is to be flipped vertically; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encoding in frequency order.
Docs.value: `true` to encode the image in frequency order; `false` to encode the image by its spatial orientation. The default is `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of horizontal divisions to use during compression encoding. A single division creates two horizontal regions.
Docs.value: The number of horizontal divisions to use during compression encoding. The value range is 0 to 4095. The default is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If is `true`, HorizontalTileSlices must be set to 0. A tile created by the division can never be smaller than 16 pixels. The value is adjusted to maintain the minimum tile size. When used in combination with , a grid of tiles is formed. For example, if both properties are set to 1, the image is divided into 4 tiles. ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to ignore region overlap pixels in subregion compressed domain encoding. This feature is not currently implemented.
Docs.value: `true` if overlap is ignored; otherwise, `false`. The default is `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is valid only when is `true` and a subregion encode is requested. ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the level of image data to discard during a compressed domain transcode.
Docs.value:
The level of image data to discard during a compressed domain encoding of the image. The value range is 0 (no data discarded) to 3 (HighPass and LowPass discarded). The default is 1.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |0|No image frequency data is discarded.| |1|FlexBits are discarded. The image quality of the image is reduced without changing the effective resolution of the image.| |2|HighPass frequency data band is discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 4 in both dimensions.| |3|HighPass and LowPass frequency data bands are discarded. The image's effective resolution is reduced by a factor of 16 in both dimensions.|

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property has an effect only if is set to `true`; otherwise, it is ignored. ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the image quality level.
Docs.value: The image quality level. The range is 0 to 1.0 (lossless image quality). The default is 0.9.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encode the alpha channel data as an additional interleaved channel.
Docs.value: `true` if the image is encoded with an additional interleaved alpha channel; `false` if planar alpha channel is used. The default is `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Interleaved alpha channels are only supported by certain pixel formats. ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to encode using lossless compression.
Docs.value: `true` to use lossless compression; otherwise, `false`. The default is `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the overlap processing level.
Docs.value:
The overlap processing level. The default is 1.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |0|No overlap processing is enabled.| |1|One level of overlap processing is enabled. Encoded values of 4x4 blocks are modified based on the values of neighboring blocks.| |2|Two levels of overlap processing are enabled. In addition to the first level of processing, encoded values of 16x16 macro blocks are modified based on the values of neighboring macro blocks.|

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the compression quality for the main image.
Docs.value: The compression quality for the main image. A value of 1 is considered lossless, and higher values indicate a high compression ratio and lower image quality. The range is 1 to 255. The default is 1.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation"> of the image.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the sub-sampling level for RGB image encoding.
Docs.value:
The sub-sampling level for RGB image encoding. The range is 0 to 3. The default is 3.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |0|4:0:0 encoding. Chroma content is discarded; luminance is preserved.| |1|4:2:0 encoding. Chroma resolution is reduced by 1/4 of luminance resolution.| |2|4:2:2 encoding. Chroma resolution is reduced to 1/2 of luminance resolution.| |3|4:4:4 encoding. Chroma resolution is preserved.|

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates codec options are to be used.
Docs.value: `true` if codec options are to be used; otherwise, `false`. The default is `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When UseCodecOptions is `true`, , , and are used in place of the . When UseCodecOptions is `false`, , , and are set based on . ## XAML Text Usage

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of vertical divisions to use during compression encoding. A single division creates two vertical regions.
Docs.value: The number of vertical divisions to use during compression encoding. The value range is 0 to 4095. The default is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If is `true`, VerticalTileSlices must be set to 0. A tile created by the division can never be smaller than 16 pixels. The value is adjusted to maintain the minimum tile size. When used in combination with , a grid of tiles is formed. For example, if both properties are set to 1, the image is divided into 4 tiles. ## XAML Text Usage
